page.title: 19FARMING IN KINGS NORTON
page.content: Mr. and Mrs.Whitehouse own Gayhill Farm They own 32 {acres} and rent 44 from local landowners.They have 14 fields, 9 of which are rented.Their 6000 chickens lay 5000 eggs a week.There are 12 ewes which had 22 lambs this year. The 300 pigs were bought as weaners, and sold for {slaughter}.They have 78 Friesian beef cattle 2 labradors and a cat. Natural well water is pumped to 1/2 the farm,the rest being on mains supply. The farm is self sufficient in machinery having 2 tractors, 1 baler, 2 trailers,1 silage maker, 1 cornplant- er, 1 hedgecutter, 1 combine and 1 plough. The eggs are sorted and sold in the farm shop. {Size 4 eggs are 80p a dozen.}The front of the house is Georgian but the rear has a conservat- ion order on it as it dates back to before {1661}.By Anna Coalter and Claire Boland, Bells Farm J/I School.
